SEARCH
Package com.yidigun.utils

Class HashCodeBuilder

java.lang.Object
com.yidigun.utils.HashCodeBuilder
public class HashCodeBuilder extends Object
A utility class for building hash codes in a deterministic and consistent manner. This class was written following the Rule 09 guidelines of Effective Java, 2nd Edition (Joshua Bloch, 2014). The HashCodeBuilder simplifies the process of creating robust hash code implementations by combining the hash codes of individual values using a prime number-based algorithm. Thread safety is not guaranteed, and this class should be used in a single-threaded context. Features: - Provides multiple `append` methods to add different types of values (e.g., primitives, Objects, arrays). - Aggregates hash codes using a basic multiplier-and-add pattern with configurable base parameters. - Can calculate a final hash code via the toHashCode() method.

  • Constructor Details

    • HashCodeBuilder

      public HashCodeBuilder()
      Creates a new instance of HashCodeBuilder with the initial hash code value. This constructor initializes the internal state of the hash code computation. The starting hash code value is set to a predefined constant. This class is designed to simplify and standardize the process of creating hash codes for objects, supporting method chaining and various data types.

  • Method Details

    • toHashCode

      public static int toHashCode(Object... values)
      Generates a hash code for a variable number of input values using the HashCodeBuilder. The method combines the hash codes of the given values to produce a consistent and deterministic result.
      Parameters:
      values - the variable number of input objects to generate the hash code for. Null values are handled by using a 0 hash code for them.
      Returns:
      the computed hash code as an integer based on the input values.

    • toHashCode

      public int toHashCode()
      Retrieves the computed hash code from the HashCodeBuilder instance. This method returns the final hash code generated based on the values appended using the various append methods in the HashCodeBuilder.
      Returns:
      the computed hash code as an integer.

    • append

      public HashCodeBuilder append(int value)
      Appends an integer value to the current hash code computation. This method modifies the internal hash code state using the provided value.
      Parameters:
      value - the integer value to be appended to the hash code calculation
      Returns:
      the current instance of HashCodeBuilder, allowing for method chaining

    • append

      public HashCodeBuilder append(int... values)
      Appends an array of integer values to the current hash code computation. This method modifies the internal hash code state using the provided values.
      Parameters:
      values - the array of integer values to be appended to the hash code calculation. If the array is null or empty, no modifications are made.
      Returns:
      the current instance of HashCodeBuilder, allowing for method chaining.

    • append

      public HashCodeBuilder append(boolean value)
      Appends a boolean value to the current hash code computation. This method modifies the internal hash code state by converting the boolean value to an integer (1 for true, 0 for false) before appending it.
      Parameters:
      value - the boolean value to be appended to the hash code calculation
      Returns:
      the current instance of HashCodeBuilder, allowing for method chaining

    • append

      public HashCodeBuilder append(boolean... values)
      Appends an array of boolean values to the current hash code computation. This method modifies the internal hash code state by converting each boolean value to an integer (1 for true, 0 for false) before appending it.
      Parameters:
      values - the array of boolean values to be appended to the hash code calculation. If the array is null or empty, no modifications are made.
      Returns:
      the current instance of HashCodeBuilder, allowing for method chaining.

      the current instance of HashCodeBuilder, allowing for method chaining

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the current instance of HashCodeBuilder, allowing for method chaining.

    • append

      public HashCodeBuilder append(float value)
      Appends a float value to the current hash code computation. This method modifies the internal hash code state by converting the provided float value to its integer bit representation before appending it.
      Parameters:
      value - the float value to be appended to the hash code calculation
      Returns:
      the current instance of HashCodeBuilder, allowing for method chaining

      Returns:
      the current instance of HashCodeBuilder, allowing for method chaining.

    • append

      public HashCodeBuilder append(double value)
      Appends a double value to the current hash code computation. This method modifies the internal hash code state by converting the double value to its equivalent long bit representation before appending it.
      Parameters:
      value - the double value to be appended to the hash code calculation
      Returns:
      the current instance of HashCodeBuilder, allowing for method chaining

    • append

      public HashCodeBuilder append(double... values)
      Appends an array of double values to the current hash code computation. This method modifies the internal hash code state by converting each double value to its equivalent long bit representation before appending it.
      Parameters:
      values - the array of double values to be appended to the hash code calculation. If the array is null or empty, no modifications are made.
      Returns:
      the current instance of HashCodeBuilder, allowing for method chaining.

    • append

      public HashCodeBuilder append(Object value)
      Appends an object's hash code to the current hash code computation. This method modifies the internal hash code state by processing the hash code of the provided object. If the object is null, a predefined constant hash code is used.
      Parameters:
      value - the object whose hash code is to be appended to the hash code calculation. If the object is null, a default hash code value is appended.
      Returns:
      the current instance of HashCodeBuilder, allowing for method chaining.

    • append

      public HashCodeBuilder append(Object... values)
      Appends the hash codes of a variable number of objects to the current hash code computation. This method iterates over the provided objects and appends each non-null object's hash code. If an object is null, a predefined hash code constant is used instead.
      Parameters:
      values - the variable number of objects whose hash codes are to be appended. Null values are handled by using a predefined constant hash code.
      Returns:
      the current instance of HashCodeBuilder, allowing for method chaining.

    • append

      public HashCodeBuilder append(byte value)
      Appends a byte value to the current hash code computation. This method modifies the internal hash code state by converting the byte value to an integer before appending it.
      Parameters:
      value - the byte value to be appended to the hash code calculation
      Returns:
      the current instance of HashCodeBuilder, allowing for method chaining

    • append

      public HashCodeBuilder append(byte... values)
      Appends an array of byte values to the current hash code computation. This method modifies the internal hash code state by converting each byte value to an integer before appending it.
      Parameters:
      values - the array of byte values to be appended to the hash code calculation. If the array is null, no modifications are made.
      Returns:
      the current instance of HashCodeBuilder, allowing for method chaining.
